summary: This is a formal notification from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, dated June 30, 2008, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement. It outlines that the U.S. was prepared to name certain individuals as victims in a federal indictment and notifies Epstein of their identities, while also detailing the terms of his plea and sentence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case who entered a guilty plea to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He acknowledges receiving the victim notification list from his attorney.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the official notification document.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's attorney who received and discussed the victim notification with Epstein, and witnessed Epstein's acknowledgment of the document.

connections.description: Roy Black is identified as Epstein's attorney, who received the victim notification on his behalf and discussed it with him.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, signed the official notification to Epstein regarding the victims the U.S. was prepared to name in an indictment, as part of the plea agreement.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a guilty plea to state charges of felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution in Palm Beach County. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment followed by 18 months of community control.

events.title: Notification of Identified Victims
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally notifies Jeffrey Epstein, through his attorney, of the list of individuals whom the United States was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment.

locations: 15th Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges (solicitation and procurement of minors for prostitution) on June 30, 2008, receiving a sentence of 12 months in prison plus 18 months of community control.

The federal prosecution was deferred in favor of the state plea, contingent on conditions including Epstein's acknowledgment of a list of victims the U.S. was prepared to name in a federal indictment.
The document is a formal notification from U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta to Epstein, delivered via his attorney Roy Black, identifying those potential victims.
Epstein waived evidentiary challenges to the use of this redacted notification document in any future judicial proceedings between himself and any identified victim.
